text: A CREDIT CARD - propped up on a register screen. The name Sandy Bigelow Patterson. The menu screen shows 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball The bartender enters another order onto the tab-- 1 - Mellonball --then carries a GREEN COCKTAIL over to: A WOMAN - Carefully crafted, retro style hair. Wiglike. L bright red. Long fingernails. Her outfit is coordinated, because the good people at Jac Smith coordinated it for her. Her credit card says Sandy Patterson, but we will call he DIANA. And Diana is shitfaced. She takes the drink and downs it in one long gulp. Looks the man next to her at the bar, who talks with a woman.
Hey. Hey chin. What's your name? THE GUY - handsome, dimpled chin, turns warily to her.
Kyle.
Kyle, you're a cool guy, right? Let me get you a drink. On me.

It's okay. We're actually having a private conversation. He angles his body to cut this weirdo off from them. A slight flash of rejection crosses her face. Then she se his CREDIT CARD RECEIPT on the bar. She casually takes it, like a pickpocket. Then she looks around at the rest of the people in the ba Nicer clientele. Couples, groups. Respectable.
You guys are my FRIENDS! I'm buying my friends a shot! She grabs the bottle of MIDORI from the bar. The bartende puts a hand on her wrist.
These aren't your friends. And I think you've had enough.
(quite serious) I've had enough when the card stops working. He reluctantly lets her have the Midori. She turns.
Okay, who wants a Melon Ba--- She stumbles over the stool rungs and FALLS out of frame.

(struggles back up) I'm okay! I'm good! I gotta be honest, there's an angel looking out for me, cuz normally that's a cracked rib. Pulled a lotta g's there. Diana hears tittering. Some pretty women at a table laugh at her. Rolling their eyes. Their perfect boyfriends too. A flicker of pain crosses Diana face once more. Then she walks over to their table with an honest, warm smile.
Hey guys, you look like party people. Shots are on me.
Uh. No. Thank you.
(waves the bottle) C'mon. This is the good stuff! The girl's boyfriend stands up. Puts a hand on her.
She said fuck off, dumptruck. Diana looks down at the guy's hand. Back at his face.
POV through the windshield. Sirens on, red lights flashin The squad car pulls up to THE VILLE.
Two COPS enter and see: A BRAWL. Diana is BEATING THE CRA out of the bitchy girl's BOYFRIEND. The cops drag her off.
I'm cool! I'm cool! She LUNGES for the guy again. They restrain her.
You're under arrest for assault and public intoxication.
No I'm not. I'm not. The weary cop takes out a Breathalyzer.
Blow into this. She inhales DEEPLY, puts her mouth on the Breathalyzer... .+-and PUKES a GREEN WAVE of MIDORI into it.
How'd I do?
The cop walks her stumbly ass over to the mugshot area. The BOOKING OFFICER checks her Florida State driver's lic Sandy Bigelow Patterson, date of birth May 18th, 1973.
Huh. Look at that. You're gonna be 40 in a couple of weeks. Diana looks over at him, trying to comprehend his words.
Happy birthday, Sandy Patterson.  THE CAMERA FLASHES, and we're...
A man blinks from a CAMERA FLASH.
Happy birthday, Sandy Patterson. TRISH, 36, his pregnant wife. She KISSES him. Sandy sits around a birthday cake with Trish and his daug FRANNY, 8 and JESSIE, 7, who take pictures with mommy's p

Make a wish, daddy! Sandy looks at his beautiful wife. His adorable little gi Then he takes in their cramped apartment. Rattling window unit. Cramped space. Bad IKEA furniture. Street noise. He has his wish. He blows out the candles. The girls CLAP.
I made you this, daddy. She hands Sandy a TIE made of construction paper and yarn It says YUO ARE THE BEST DADY.

Oh, this looks expensive. Did you steal this tie? Thief! Thief! He starts tickling her. She howls "no" through her giggle For a moment, Sandy forgets the tiny apartment and the rattling AC and just enjoys the moment. Looks at Trish.

Thanks. This was a really nice-- He's cut off by A NOISE from the other side of the apartm wall. THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP. Picture frames rattle. And now the unmistakable moaning of a woman being screwed
(raised voice) Hey Derek? Kristi? Thin walls. Remember?
Sorry! Franny's eyes go wide. Naughty "oooocco0ch" smile on her
Okay. Bedtime.
Franny and Jessie sleep quietly. Bunkbeds. Tiny room. Tri gently closes the door. Crosses back to the table, where the cake has been pushed aside to make room for Sandy's laptop. And a stack of bil
So?
After rent, utilities, gas, phones, we're actually up on the month. She's impressed. He turns his laptop to show her. $14.23.
Half of that's mine. (he's not laughing) It's okay. We're making it. Right?
Until she's born. And the girls need braces. Or college. Or weddings.
What about a raise? They haven't given you one in like--
It's the financial industry. I can't exactly argue things are going well.
I'm sure the partners are doing fine.
Well I'm not a partner. Trish shuts up. That came out wrong. Sandy looks at his c The icing spells out 40th Birthd.
I'm sorry. (MORE )
I thought I'd be further along. A house. A yard. A better life for you guys.
This is a better life.
Really? Two grand in savings? This place? Three kids to a room?
Babe, you're doing the best you can.
Don't say that. That can't be true. And then... THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP through the wal
(instant rage) Hey KRISTI! You ever get a PERIOD? The thumping stops. Sandy closes his laptop.
I'm going to bed. He walks off, resigned. The weight of the world.
Sun rises over the city.
Breakfast time chaos. Sandy barrels through, pulls his ja on, grabs his laptop case, steps over the dog--
Lunch! He swings back over, grabs a brown bag from Trish, gives a quick kiss. Heads out.
A skyscraper downtown.

The placard next to the door says: Sandy Patterson - Acco Processing. The office is basically a glorified cubicle. Sandy works industriously. STAMPS and NOTARIZES documents Legal disclaimers are SCANNED and EMAILED. Fills in IRS f Bank forms. SEC forms. FINRA forms. Trade authorization f Sandy Patterson is a master of paperwork and detail. And at NOON sharp: he stops. The inbox is EMPTY. He takes out his lunch. There's a note in the bag from Tr "Something good will happen today."
Patterson! BRYAN CASEY, 31, sharp suit, standing in Sandy's doorway. Younger than Sandy, but far better dressed.
Did I ask you to paper the Westfield sweep account under the holding corp?
Yup.
Shit. It was supposed to go under--
--the subsidiary, so you can roll over the qualified plan. Sandy hands Bryan an envelope.
I did it both ways. Had a feeling. Bryan takes the forms. Relieved. Points happily as he exi
You're the best, Patterson. The best. Sandy enjoys the moment. A little pride in himself, for o The PHONE RINGS. He answers, chipper.
This is Sandy Patterson.
Mr. Cornish needs you in his office for a notarize.
Oh! Uh, sure, right away! He hangs up. Looks at Trish's note. Something good. It's up to him to make it happen...
Sandy enters the large, plush corner office. JIM CORNISH, 50, is a short, imperious man. The big wheel. He barely acknowledges Sandy's existence. Just waves at t forms on the coffee table.
New account forms. Stamp 'em. Sandy takes out a notary book and stamp. Works up the cou
Uh, Jim? Cornish looks at Sandy. Why is this peon talking?
I know your time is limited, so I thought I'd squeeze this in. I've been here five years, and I haven't gotten a raise. Now I know times are--
Yes! Yes?

There's the man!!! Cornish gets up, walks right past Sandy to greet the clie who just walked into the office. Sandy turns to see Cornish man-hugging: LARRY BIRD. The Celtic great. The most famous man in Bost
God, you look terrific. Linda! Two coffees! C'mon, sit down.  Sandy can't believe this. He's awestruck.
Larry Bird. I'm--
Just get the stamp out. Larry signs the three forms, watching as Sandy fumbles to open his ink pad.
Who's this? The investment guy in charge of signatures?
Ha. No, he's not an investment guy. He just handles the paperwork.
I'm like an assistant investment guy.
Mmmmmmmm, not quite as good that. He's more like someone who works for investment guys, but isn't an investment guy and doesn't have the training or license to ever be an investment guy.
(clinging to dignity) I provide back office support for--
Actually, he's a bit like those guys who gave you towels, mopped up your sweat? Hung around Celtics, but weren't Celtics?
(laughs at Sandy) Oh, you're the sweat guy! Hey, every team needs a sweat guy. Cornish laughs with Larry. Sandy forces himself to join i But he's dying inside. Cornish points to the forms.
Go ahead and stamp.
Of course. I'll just need a valid form of ID... driver's license?  10.
Oh. I left my wallet in the car. (to Cornish) I'll email you the number.
Oh. Um-- I do need to see it.
I just told you, I don't have it.
Maybe you could run down and get it?
Are you out of your mind?
Are you saying I'm not Larry Bird?
No, of course not! But I took a public oath. I can't notarize a document without confirming ID.
His FACE is his ID, you jackass!
I'm Larry Bird!
I know! But the rules-- ! Larry Bird stands up. Furious.
I am six foot nine! This is BOSTON!
Stamp it, Patterson! Larry Bird grabs for the stamp. Sandy clutches it to his chest, frightened.
Okay!!! Sandy stamps each of the three contracts. WHACK! WHACK! W
Now get out.
Sandy slumps back into his office, sits down. Hot with sh Something good will happen today. He CRUMPLES the note up and throws it out. His PHONE RINGS, startling him. He answers. No longer chi
This is Sandy Patterson.
Yes, Sandy? I'm Jeanette with Lady's Choice salon confirming your appointment for this Wednesday at three?
I'm sorry, you have the wrong number.
Sandy Bigelow Patterson? Odd. His middle name. That gets his attention.
Yes, but-- (checks the caller ID) Where are you calling from?
Homestead, Florida.
I'm in Boston. How did you get this number?
You didn't leave one when you made the appointment, so we Googled you.
Well, I'm sorry, but you have the wrong person.  12.
Are you sure?
You're Lady's Choice in Florida. I'm a man in Massachusetts.
So you're not Sandy Patterson?
No! I'm no one! GOODBYE! Sandy slams the phone down. A knock on his door. It's Bryan Casey, looking deadly ser
We need to talk. Oh no.
Bryan enters the stairwell. Stonefaced. Sandy follows.
Bryan, you gotta understand, this Larry Bird thing wasn't my-- Sandy stops. Bryan's there, but so are THREE OTHER GUYS. in expensive suits. All around 30. All looking at him.
We're leaving Prominence.
(stunned) You guys book half the business here.
We know. And if it were up to Cornish, we'd be sucking his ass for the rest of our lives. That's why we're starting our own firm, and we're taking all of our clients with us.
Jesus-- that's a four billion dollar portfolio...
Five. Come with us.  13. Sandy is floored. Him?
You're the best at what you do. You'll be a junior partner. Run the back office, plus a piece of the business. What are you making now?
Fifty.
You're gonna make fifty next month.
Oh my god. When is this happening?
Now.

Bryan and his partners stride out to the middle of the fl amidst the cubicles and offices. Sandy follows, hanging back, as Bryan picks up a STAPLER BANGS ON THE WALL, getting everyone's attention. He steps up and stands on a desk.
The four of us are leaving to start a new company. He raises his Blackberry and presses a button.
You now have our new contact info. Everyone stops. You can hear a pin drop. This is nuclear.
We will need secretaries. Clerks. IT. You can submit applications on--
Cornish stands across the way. Addresses the troops.
Anyone who stays right where they are gets a 5% raise, here and now. (MORE )

Anyone who moves-- will regret it. This firm has offices in twenty cities across five continents. You don't want us for an enemy. Sandy takes that in. The raise. The threat. SECURITY grabs hold of the four rebels.
Last chance. Who's with us? The room is dead silent. No one moves. Cornish gloats.
I am. Cornish looks around, searching for the traitor.
Who said that?
(petrified) I did. Cornish stares in disbelief and fury at Sandy. As securit marches him out with Bryan and the others--

You better pray this works out, Patterson, because I'm killing you everywhere else! No one will hire you! Not here, not anywhere! You hear me? You're a dead man! In this town, in this business! Everywhere you go! WHO DO YOU THINK YOU ARE?

head_text.subj: WHO DO YOU THINK YOU ARE

text: Diana rides up the escalator, drinking an Orange Julius, talking on a crappy cell phone.

Of course I appreciate it. Yes. Ugh, fine. "Thank you for bailing me out, Moshe." I don't know. Figure two weeks. I'll be done in an hour, and then it's all yours. Okay? As she steps off the elevator, the phone goes BOOP. Call dropped. She casually TOSSES the phone into a TRASH BIN.  15.
She points a ring out to the saleswoman. Credit card in h
That one looks great. Lost my wedding ring. Can you believe it? Fifteen years. He's a big stockbroker. But it's not about stuff, you know? It's about partnership.
Diana stuffs an entire cinnamon sugar pretzel in her mout Talks to the cashier through a wad of dough.
Mmm. Low blood sugar. It's working. This is very fresh.
The salesgirl SWIPES the card. Diana shows off her new ri
Yeah, we just got married. He's a surgeon. He fixes smiles. Diana hears some whispered GIGGLING. Turns to catch two counter girls quietly mocking her appearance. She pretends to not notice.
Diana has another pretzel in her mouth. Talks through an even larger quantity of dough to the same cashier.
Another crash. It's picking up. Is that a free sample? Is that onion? (chokes, then clears) Mmm. There's a nice tang to that.
Diana looks at a monitor showing footage for something ca FAMILY FUN PACKAGE. A happy family is whitewater rafting.  16.
So how old are your kids?
15, 12, 10, 8 and 6. Jaden, Cathy, Sam, JP and Anna. She eyes the large yellow inflatable on display.
Huh. I could buy raft...
Diana VIBRATES in a massage chair. Asleep. Drooling. An employee nudges her. She wakes spastically.
What the fuck?

Ma'am? Your card and your receipt? Oh. She gets her bearings. Checks the receipt. One massag chair plus home delivery. $1,899.99. Diana does some math her head, then hands the card back to the salesman.
Keep it. It's done. The salesman takes the card back, confused. Diana turns o on the massage chair so that's she face down. Still vibra
A Yaris. Sandy drives, cell phone to his ear. It's ringin BOOP. He checks his phone. TRISH (HOME) - CALL FAILED. The LOW GAS alert pings on the dashboard.
Sandy's redialing Trish as he swipes his card at the pump Boop. Dropped call. Again. The pump says DECLINED - SEE MANAGER. Huh?  17.
The attendant, ARUN, sits in his glassed-in cashier booth talking loudly in HINDI on his BLUETOOTH earpiece.
Excuse me? Something's wrong with pump 5. It's not taking my card. Sandy passes it through the tray. Arun takes it, swipes i
Oh, look at this, buddy! Arun holds up the scanner. It says INVLD. - DESTROY CARD.
What? Why would it say that?
Because you don't pay your fucking bills, deadbeat!
I absolutely pay my bills! And you can't talk to customers like that!
Yes I can. Bulletproof glass. Suck my balls. Arun starts talking in Hindi on his bluetooth. Laughs.
Who is that? Who are you talking to? Arun turns a WEBCAM toward Sandy's credit card.
My family in Mumbai. They're watching me cut up your card. I'm slingboxing this shit to them.
Do not cut that card up! He CUTS THE CARD. Then hits SPEAKER on his cell phone. We hear people laughing, singing and clapping.
Ha ha! You like this song? The chorus means "fuck you".
Sandy drives, fuming. Phone to his ear. It's ringing.
Hello, this is Loretta with MobiCom. With whom am I speaking?
Sandy Patterson.
And can I have the last four of your social?
And how may I assist you this evening?
I can't seem to make any calls.
Yes, I see we've suspended your service for an overdue balance of $369.73.
No, that's a mistake. I pay this bill regularly.
I'm sorry, sir. If you'd like to pay by phone right now, we can restore service to all three of your numbers.
Three? What three? I have two numbers. My wife and myself.
I'm showing a third line, added two months ago. Area code 305-697--
305? Where is that?
Homestead, Florida. 18. Homestead. Where that salon was? And then: Whoooo! Flashi sirens behind him.  19.
Shit.
Sandy's pulled over. The COP approaches his window.
We have a hands-free phone law, sir. License and registration.
The cop walks back over. Hand on the butt of his gun.
Step out of the car, Mr. Patterson.
(gets out) Really? Okay. Didn't realize it was that big of a-- OW! The cop SPINS HIM AROUND. SLAMS HIM against the hood of h car. Arm bent behind his back.
Sandy sits alone. Handcuffed. Shell-shocked. Two DETECTIVES enter. Close the door behind them. The lea detective is REILLY, 40's. Moustache. Men's Wearhouse.
Mr. Patterson, I'm Detective Reilly.
Listen, there's been a mistake.
There's no mistake. The arresting officer ran your license through the NCIC. You were booked for felony assault two weeks ago in Florida.
Florida? Wait-- was it Homestead?  20.
Oh good, so we're dropping the whole "there's been a mistake". You missed your court date this morning. Judge issued a warrant, we ship you down there tomorrow. Enjoy the weather.
Waitwaitwait. Listen. Please! Someone with my name is doing these things. Making salon appointments, opening phone accounts--
Are you or are you not Sandy Bigelow Patterson, born May 18th, 1973?
I am, but-- I swear! This is someone else. It's not me.
(beat, then to his partner) Call Homestead PD. Pull the mugshot.
Reilly's partner walks back in the room. Hands Reilly a folder. Reilly opens it. Examines what's inside.

Woof. Uncuff him. The partner removes Sandy's cuffs. Reilly takes a documen from the folder, puts it on the table. Turns it toward Sa It's the MUGSHOT of DIANA. Holding a name card and birthd Sandy Bigelow Patterson. 5-18-73.
Who the hell is this?
If I had to guess, I'd say it's the woman who stole your identity. Obviously taking advantage of the fact that you have a girly name.
It's not girly. It's unisex. So what is this-- like credit card fraud?  21.

No, it's worse than that. They get a hold of your name, birth date, social security-- then they run up debt, get arrested, commit crimes-- as you. They tunnel into your life like a termite and rot you out from the inside until there's nothing left. (claps his hands) Anyhoo, you'll fill out some forms, we'll put a top level fraud alert out, that's about that.
What? No, you have to stop her! You have to go get this woman!

We don't "go get" anyone. We're Boston PD. All we do is open and close the case. If she buys something on Amazon, Seattle PD investigates. Your mobile company's in Connecticut? Hartford PD handles that. And so on and so forth for every single theft.
How long does that take?
Six months to a year.

Yeah, let me explain our priorities. (gestures with his hand) See, up here, we got our murders and rapes. (sweeps from high to low) Then allll11111 this is the stupid shit people do when they're drunk or in love. (low to the ground) Down here is identity theft.
So I'm on the bottom.
Well, below that's marijuana, cuz you know, fuck it. Everybody gets high. (MORE )
(rises) That's all. You're free to go. Take that mugshot with you. Might help you with the credit card companies.
Jesus. (writes on a pad) This is my new work contact info. Call me if you hear anything.
I'll do that. In six months to a year.
Franny and Jessie watch TV. Trish sits at the kitchen tab with Sandy, who has his laptop out. Piles of bills.
Just make a list of each account, and I'll call, one by one, and we'll settle this tonight. Clean slate.
(quietly panicked) Okay.
There's nothing to worry about.
Okay.
Just gonna pull up the credit card-- WHAT? Look at this! Jewelry? A massage chair? We don't have a pot to piss in, she's buying massage chairs?
Sandy.
Hold on. I'm checking our credit rating. The TRW screen says 205. Sandy reels. Then recovers.
Okay, no problem. We'll start with the First Boston Visa. (MORE )
They're a big bank, we're good customers, they'll get it. TEN MINUTES LATER - Sandy's on the phone, pacing. Trish watches, her panic mounting by the second.

What do you mean you don't believe me? I have a police report! No, not for the jewelry or the massage chair, I just found out about that! Prove? How I do prove I didn't buy something? My identity was stolen! Oh, I'ma liar now? You're calling me a LIAR? You know what? THIS IS WHY EVERYONE HATES BANKS! Get your manager! (beat) Hello? Hello? (tosses the phone) GodDAMMIT! The girls look over at their dad. Frightened.
Sandy.
What.
You quit your job. He registers her absolute panic. Moves into calming mode.
Okay, babe, listen. The new job is a great thing. I swear to you. This is going to get us out of here, into a house, a new life--
We don't have credit I'll ask Bryan for an cards. We don't have advance tomorrow. cell phones.
We need a new crib and Trish, Trish, honey. I diapers and-- have it under control. Trish takes a breath. Then puts a hand on his. Nods.

Daddy? The TV's broken.  24. Sandy looks up at the TV. The screen says: ERROR 713b: Yo service has been disrupted due to an outstanding balance. Sandy leans back in his chair. This is not under control.
Another high-rise in the business district.
The elevator dings. Sandy steps out into THE NEW OFFICES. Workers install new computers, move in furniture, etc. Sandy sees Bryan in the CONFERENCE ROOM.
Bryan, can I talk to you for a second?
Just a sec. I want you to meet Dave Weiss. He heads up the endowment at Boston University. Sandy shakes hands with DAVE WEISS, 50's.
Sandy's our back office whiz. Handles legal, accounts, every single transaction. He's amazing.
Good to hear. We're putting nearly a billion dollars on your desk.
I'll make sure to take great care of you, sir. Umm, Bryan, if I could just grab one quick--
Mr. Patterson! Sandy, Bryan and Weiss turn to see: DETECTIVE REILLY and two uniformed cops emerging from the elevator. Sandy quickly turns to Bryan.
It's okay. My identity was stolen. It's a huge mess. Reilly and Sandy shake hands.  25.
So-- you have some news?
Indeed I do. You're under investigation for narcotics trafficking. Wait-- what??? Bryan and the client stare in shock.
We have a warrant to search the premises. Cuff him.
Sandy sits alone. The FLAT SCREEN TV is on, the sound mut REILLY enters with Bryan and one of the cops.
Okay, uncuff him.
You mind explaining what's going on?

Chicago PD busted an oxycontin ring last night. Your name and address were on a list of buyers. (off Sandy's reaction) I'm not an idiot, Mr. Patterson. I know there's a halfway decent chance it's your friend in Florida. Which means there's a halfway decent chance it's not. Until I can prove you didn't do this, it's an open investigation.
For narcotics. Sandy, I'm sorry, but--

Bryan-- please don't We almost lost BU over do this. I can't go this. We're asking people back to Cornish, he's to entrust you with their blackballing me information! Account codes, everywhere else-- balances, access to funds--
I am unemployable right You can't. Not with this now, Brian! I have no over your head. You CAN'T money, no credit-- WORK HERE! That's it. Sandy puts his head in his hands.  26.
For what it's worth, I am sorry. Sandy doesn't move. Bryan walks Reilly out. Finally, Sandy lifts his head. Alone. Just him and the si TV. An ad. A woman massages shampoo into her scalp. Holy shit.
Bryan and Reilly turn back to him.
What if I knew where she was? I find her, and I turn her over to the police? Would you clear my name?
They'd put her up on Florida charges first. It'd be a year before we'd get a crack at her. She'd have to be standing right here to do you any good.
That's the new standard for police work? The criminal has to STAND RIGHT
You have a good day.
Wait! (point of no return) What if I brought her to you?
C'mon, Mr. Patterson.
If I bring her to you and she gives a full statement-- owns up to everything-- will you clear my name?
If all that happens. Yeah. Sure. Reilly EXITS.  27.
Sandy, I'm sorry, but we don't have time. Accounts are rolling in, you can't clear a background check I need someone doing the work now.
Bryan, I have a family. I stood up for you. Please.
(beat, then) I'll give you five days.
(already running out) Thank you!
Five days! That's all I can do!
Sandy packs a SUITCASE while he's on the phone. Trish wat

Yes, this is Sandy Patterson, you called the other day? I want to confirm that appointment. It was for my wife, she's gonna be in the area, I didn't realize. Tomorrow at three, right? And your address again? (scribbles it down) Great, got it. She'll be there. He hangs up.
This is insane. (holds up handcuffs) Where did you even get these?
You know. That place. Oh, and I borrowed your anxiety pills. In case I have to coax her on to the plane.
No, that's fine. Cause WHY WOULD I
Shhh shhh shhh. I'm gonna fly out, get her, fly back, and we're done.  28.
Daddy? Are you going on a trip? The girls stand in the door. He kneels down and hugs them

I am. I'm going to pretty much the worst place in America-- but when I come back, I'm going to be a better daddy. And we're going to live ina big house with a yard and presents and braces and weddings. Okay? (kisses them both) Okay, go on. Be good! They run out. Trish folds her arms, a nervous wreck.
I paid the mobile bill. Our phones are back on, I'll call you every step of the way.
I don't like this. It's dangerous.
It's one woman. She's five foot nothing. She's a hobbit. (kisses her) I won't let you down. She frowns, then softens. Kisses him back.
You never do. Go get the bitch.
The BOS-MIA flight comes in for a landing...
Sandy drives a rented CHEVY COBALT toward HOMESTEAD

A depressed, far distant suburb of Miami. SANDY - sits in his car, windows down. Sweating. Looking LADY'S CHOICE SALON - tacky, tacky, tacky. A large sign o the window says TAN HAIR.  29. Sandy checks his watch. Five past noon. And then-- a new NISSAN pulls into the lot. Sticker in the window. DIANA gets out of the car. Walks into Lady's Choice. Sandy sits back. He's got her.
Diana emerges. Her bad hair is still bad, but blacker and bigger. Nails are bright pink. Jesus. What a look.

SANDY follows her, keeping an appropriate distance. DIANA glances at her rearview mirror. Sees the Cobalt following her. Hmmm. She accelerates. SANDY speeds up as well. Doesn't want to lose her. They approach an ELEVATED CAUSEWAY over marshy SWAMP. The only two cars visible for miles. DIANA accelerates more. SANDY keeps up. Until-- SCREEEE! Diana SLAMS ON HER BRAKES.
Shit! He slams on HIS BRAKES-- SKIDS-- and-- CRUNCH-- he rear-e her at about 15 mph. Not even enough to pop the airbags.
Sandy gets out of his car. Sees Diana slowly get out of h She's holding her neck.
Ugh. My neck! Son of a bitch! He can't believe it. She's pulling a scam.
I'm sorry. You stopped so short. He walks around her car, surveying the damage. Subtly pla himself between her and her driver's side door.  30.
There was a gopher in the road. OW, my spine!
You know what? This is totally my fault. Let's exchange information. My insurance will cover everything.
All right. Yeah. Cool. Here. (hands him her license) Or maybe we could just do cash. Save you a little on your rates.
You would do that for me?
I would. I'm a good person. You know? Like, what would Jesus do?
Jesus doesn't have insurance?
No, he's god. What's wrong with you?
(reads her license) Sandy Bigelow Patterson. Bigelow. You don't hear that too often.
It's a family name. Mother's side. Goes back to the Mayflower. Jeremiah Bigelow. He was a bear hunter.

Huh. Interesting. Here's my license. She takes it. Looks at it. Sandy Bigelow Patterson. She slowly removes her hand from her neck. Straightens he posture. Looks back at Sandy like she's a different perso Then she PUNCHES him in the THROAT. Sandy drops like a dead man, still conscious, but gagging his own throat. She tries to push past him into her car, he BLOCKS HER ACCESS to the door while he tries to breath She runs and gets into HIS car. Starts it up. Backs up.  31. Watching this, gasping for air, Sandy gets into HER car. Turns the key, but the engine won't turn over. Then: WHAM! He lurches forward into the steering wheel.
